newsitem.title: KENYA: Strike delays flights to and from Kenya.
newsitem.headline: Strike delays flights to and from Kenya.

text.p: Flights in and out of Kenyan airports ran late on Tuesday for the fourth straight day because of a strike by air traffic controllers, airport sources said.
An official from the Ministry of Transport and Communciations warned the strikers to go back to work or they would be considered in breach of their contracts.

"The permanent secretary in the ministry, Stanley Murage, has told the air traffic controllers they must return to work by 4 p.m. local (1300 GMT) today (Tuesday) or else they will be in breach of their work contracts," a ministry spokesman said.
The civil aviation authorities have replaced the strikers with instructors and administrators who are short of practical experience.
Airline officials said some international flights left Nairobi up to one hour late because the substitute air traffic controllers could not handle the workload.
"They don't have enough manpower and they are not that experienced but they are doing their best," one official said.
Kenya Airways has told travel agents that its flights to and from the Lake Victoria town of Kisumu will run one hour behind schedule, the travel agents said.
The ministry spokesman said the air traffic controllers wanted their basic salaries increased 50-fold to 261,510 shillings ($4,670) from 5,000 shillings ($90) a month.
